df-od
blocks.content: Define the order of an element in a group. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jul-2014.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 4-Sep-2015.) (Revised by AV, 5-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-od(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cod, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpt(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), csb(s3, crab(s2, cn, wceq(co(cv(s2), cfv(cmg, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cfv(c0g, cv(s0)))), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s3), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s3), emptycls))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-od(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ od =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(Base ` s0)‚Ü¶[{ s2 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s2[(.g ` s0)]s1)=(0 ` s0)} / s3]if(s3 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s3, ‚Ñù, <))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: df-gex
blocks.content: Define the exponent of a group. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jul-2014.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 4-Sep-2015.) (Revised by AV, 26-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-gex(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cgex, cmpt(s0, universe, csb(s3, crab(s1, cn, wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wceq(co(cv(s1), cfv(cmg, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), cfv(c0g, cv(s0))))), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s3), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s3), emptycls)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-gex(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ gEx =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï | ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà(Base ` s0),(s1[(.g ` s0)]s2)=(0 ` s0))} / s3]if(s3 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s3, ‚Ñù, <)))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: df-pgp
blocks.content: Define the set of p-groups, which are groups such that every element has a power of ` p ` as its order. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2015.) (Revised by AV, 5-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-pgp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cpgp, copab(s0, s1, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cprime), wcel(cv(s1), cgrp)), wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s1)), wrex(s3, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, cv(s1)), cv(s2)), co(cv(s0), cexp, cv(s3))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
}

blocks.name: df-slw
blocks.content: Define the set of Sylow p-subgroups of a group ` g ` . A Sylow p-subgroup is a p-group that is not a subgroup of any other p-groups in ` g ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-slw(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cslw, cmpo(s0, s1, cprime, cgrp, crab(s2, cfv(csubg, cv(s1)), wral(s3, cfv(csubg, cv(s1)), wb(wa(wss(cv(s2), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s0), cpgp, co(cv(s1), cress, cv(s3)))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s3)))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-slw(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ pSyl =(s0 ‚àà Prime, s1 ‚àà Grp ‚Ü¶ { s2 ‚àà(SubGrp ` s1)| ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà(SubGrp ` s1),((s2 ‚äÜ s3 ‚àß s0[pGrp](s1[|`s]s3))‚Üî s2 = s3))})
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
}

blocks.name: odfval
blocks.content: Value of the order function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jul-2014.) (Revised by AV, 5-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm odfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls)))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cmg, c4))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(c0g, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cod, c4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  a1ii(wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))))), diffsc(s0, c2))
  a1ii(wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  a1ii(wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))))), diffsc(s1, c2))
  a1ii(wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))))), diffsc(s1, c3))
  eqtri(c0, cmpt(s0, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls)))), cfv(cod, c4))
  pm2.61i(wceq(cfv(cod, c4), cmpt(s0, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))))), wcel(c4, universe))
  mptfvmpt(s0, hs0, c4, universe, cod, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))), cmpt(s0, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), cfv(cmg, cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), cfv(c0g, cv(hs0)))), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls)))), cbs, c4)
  mpteq12dv(s0, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), cfv(cmg, cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), cfv(c0g, cv(hs0)))), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))), c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))), wceq(cv(hs0), c4))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c1, cfv(cbs, c4), wceq(cv(hs0), c4))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c4, cbs)
  csbeq1d(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), cfv(cmg, cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), cfv(c0g, cv(hs0)))), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls)), crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), wceq(cv(hs0), c4))
  rabbidv(s1, cn, wceq(cv(hs0), c4), wceq(co(cv(s1), cfv(cmg, cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), cfv(c0g, cv(hs0))), wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3))
  eqeq12d(co(cv(s1), cfv(cmg, cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), cfv(c0g, cv(hs0)), co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3, wceq(cv(hs0), c4))
  oveqd(cv(s1), cfv(cmg, cv(hs0)), cv(s0), c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c4))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cmg, cv(hs0)), c2, cfv(cmg, c4), wceq(cv(hs0), c4))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c4, cmg)
  syl6eqr(cfv(c0g, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0g, c4), wceq(cv(hs0), c4))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c4, c0g)
  df-od(hs0, s0, s1, s2)
  eqtr4d(cfv(cod, c4), cmpt(s0, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls)))), emptycls, wn(wcel(c4, universe)))
  fvprc(c4, cod)
  syl6eq(cmpt(s0, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls)))), emptycls, cmpt(s0, emptycls, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls)))), wn(wcel(c4, universe)))
  mpteq1d(s0, c1, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))), emptycls, wn(wcel(c4, universe)))
  syl5eq(c1, emptycls, cfv(cbs, c4), wn(wcel(c4, universe)))
  fvprc(c4, cbs)
  mpt0(s0, csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))))
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(csb(s2, crab(s1, cn, wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), c3)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(s2), cr, clt), wceq(cv(s2), emptycls))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c4)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c4)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm odfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ c0 =(s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <)))
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Base ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(.g ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(0 ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(od ` c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
} = {
  a1ii(c0 =(s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <))), d(s0, c2))
  a1ii(c0 =(s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <))), d(s0, c3))
  a1ii(c0 =(s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <))), d(s1, c2))
  a1ii(c0 =(s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <))), d(s1, c3))
  eqtri(c0, (s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <))), (od ` c4))
  pm2.61i((od ` c4)=(s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <))), c4 ‚àà ùïå)
  mptfvmpt(s0, hs0, c4, universe, cod, c1, [{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <)), (s0 ‚àà(Base ` hs0)‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[(.g ` hs0)]s0)=(0 ` hs0)} / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <))), cbs, c4)
  mpteq12dv(s0, (Base ` hs0), [{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[(.g ` hs0)]s0)=(0 ` hs0)} / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <)), c1, [{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <)), hs0 = c4)
  syl6eqr((Base ` hs0), c1, (Base ` c4), hs0 = c4)
  fveq2(hs0, c4, cbs)
  csbeq1d(s2, { s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[(.g ` hs0)]s0)=(0 ` hs0)}, if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <)), { s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 }, hs0 = c4)
  rabbidv(s1, cn, hs0 = c4, (s1[(.g ` hs0)]s0)=(0 ` hs0), (s1[c2]s0)= c3)
  eqeq12d((s1[(.g ` hs0)]s0), (0 ` hs0), (s1[c2]s0), c3, hs0 = c4)
  oveqd(s1, (.g ` hs0), s0, c2, hs0 = c4)
  syl6eqr((.g ` hs0), c2, (.g ` c4), hs0 = c4)
  fveq2(hs0, c4, cmg)
  syl6eqr((0 ` hs0), c3, (0 ` c4), hs0 = c4)
  fveq2(hs0, c4, c0g)
  df-od(hs0, s0, s1, s2)
  eqtr4d((od ` c4), (s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <))), emptycls, ¬¨ c4 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvprc(c4, cod)
  syl6eq((s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <))), emptycls, (s0 ‚àà ‚àÖ ‚Ü¶[{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <))), ¬¨ c4 ‚àà ùïå)
  mpteq1d(s0, c1, [{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <)), emptycls, ¬¨ c4 ‚àà ùïå)
  syl5eq(c1, emptycls, (Base ` c4), ¬¨ c4 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvprc(c4, cbs)
  mpt0(s0, [{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <)))
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c([{ s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(s1[c2]s0)= c3 } / s2]if(s2 = ‚àÖ, 0, inf(s2, ‚Ñù, <)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c4)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, c4)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: odval
blocks.content: Second substitution for the group order definition. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jul-2014.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.) (Revised by AV, 5-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm odval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), cif(nat0, cinf(c3, cr, clt), wceq(c3, emptycls))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cmg, c4))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(c0g, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cod, c4))
  -| wceq(c3, crab(s0, cn, wceq(co(cv(s0), c5, c0), c6)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, c1, c2, cif(nat0, cinf(c3, cr, clt), wceq(c3, emptycls)), csb(hs1, crab(s0, cn, wceq(co(cv(s0), c5, cv(hs0)), c6)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(hs1), cr, clt), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls))))
  syl6eq(csb(hs1, crab(s0, cn, wceq(co(cv(s0), c5, cv(hs0)), c6)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(hs1), cr, clt), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls))), cif(nat0, cinf(c3, cr, clt), wceq(c3, emptycls)), csb(hs1, c3, cif(nat0, cinf(cv(hs1), cr, clt), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  csbeq1d(hs1, crab(s0, cn, wceq(co(cv(s0), c5, cv(hs0)), c6)), cif(nat0, cinf(cv(hs1), cr, clt), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls)), c3, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  syl6eqr(crab(s0, cn, wceq(co(cv(s0), c5, cv(hs0)), c6)), c3, crab(s0, cn, wceq(co(cv(s0), c5, c0), c6)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  rabbidv(s0, cn, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(co(cv(s0), c5, cv(hs0)), c6), wceq(co(cv(s0), c5, c0), c6))
  eqeq1d(co(cv(s0), c5, cv(hs0)), c6, co(cv(s0), c5, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0), c5)
  csbie(hs1, c3, cif(nat0, cinf(cv(hs1), cr, clt), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls)), cif(nat0, cinf(c3, cr, clt), wceq(c3, emptycls)))
  rabex2(s0, c3, cn, wceq(co(cv(s0), c5, c0), c6))

blocks.name: mndodcongi
blocks.content: If two multipliers are congruent relative to the base point's order, the corresponding multiples are the same. For monoids, the reverse implication is false for elements with infinite order. For example, the powers of ` 2 mod 1 0 ` are 1,2,4,8,6,2,4,8,6,... so that the identity 1 never repeats, which is infinite order by our definition, yet other numbers like 6 appear many times in the sequence. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: oddvdsi
blocks.content: Any group element is annihilated by any multiple of its order. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm oddvdsi(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wbr(cfv(c3, c1), cdvds, c4)), wceq(co(c4, c5, c1), c6))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cod, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cmg, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(c0g, c0))
} = {
  mpbid(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wbr(cfv(c3, c1), cdvds, c4)), wceq(co(c4, c5, c1), c6), wbr(cfv(c3, c1), cdvds, c4))
  simp3(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wbr(cfv(c3, c1), cdvds, c4))
  syl3an3(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wbr(cfv(c3, c1), cdvds, c4), wb(wbr(cfv(c3, c1), cdvds, c4), wceq(co(c4, c5, c1), c6)), wcel(c4, cz))
  simprd(wbr(cfv(c3, c1), cdvds, c4), wcel(c4, cz), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), cz))
  dvdszrcl(cfv(c3, c1), c4)
  oddvds(c0, c1, c2, c4, c3, c5, c6)
}

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß(c3 ` c1)[||]c4)‚Üí(c4[c5]c1)= c6)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(od ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(.g ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(0 ` c0)
} = {

  simprd((c3 ` c1)[||]c4, c4 ‚àà ‚Ñ§, (c3 ` c1)‚àà ‚Ñ§)

blocks.name: odcong
blocks.content: If two multipliers are congruent relative to the base point's order, the corresponding multiples are the same. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm odcong(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wa(wcel(c3, cz), wcel(c4, cz))), wb(wbr(cfv(c5, c1), cdvds, co(c3, cmin, c4)), wceq(co(c3, c6, c1), co(c4, c6, c1))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))

thm odcong(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß(c3 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚àß c4 ‚àà ‚Ñ§))‚Üí((c5 ` c1)[||](c3[-]c4)‚Üî(c3[c6]c1)=(c4[c6]c1)))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Base ` c0)

  ‚ä£ c6 =(.g ` c0)

} = {

  zsubcl(c3, c4)

  syl13anc((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß(c3 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚àß c4 ‚àà ‚Ñ§)), ((c3[-]c4)[c6]c1)=((c3[c6]c1)[(-g ` c0)](c4[c6]c1)), c0 ‚àà Grp, c3 ‚àà ‚Ñ§, c4 ‚àà ‚Ñ§, c1 ‚àà c2)
  mulgsubdir(c0, c3, c4, c1, c2, c6, (-g ` c0))
  syl3anc((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß(c3 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚àß c4 ‚àà ‚Ñ§)), (((c3[c6]c1)[(-g ` c0)](c4[c6]c1))= c7 ‚Üî(c3[c6]c1)=(c4[c6]c1)), c0 ‚àà Grp, (c3[c6]c1)‚àà c2, (c4[c6]c1)‚àà c2)

  simp3l(c0 ‚àà Grp, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà ‚Ñ§, c4 ‚àà ‚Ñ§)
  mulgcl(c0, c3, c1, c2, c6)
  syl3anc((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß(c3 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚àß c4 ‚àà ‚Ñ§)), (c4[c6]c1)‚àà c2, c0 ‚àà Grp, c4 ‚àà ‚Ñ§, c1 ‚àà c2)
  simp1(c0 ‚àà Grp, c1 ‚àà c2, (c3 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚àß c4 ‚àà ‚Ñ§))
  simp3r(c0 ‚àà Grp, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà ‚Ñ§, c4 ‚àà ‚Ñ§)

thm odval2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

  odcl(c1, c2, c3, c0)

blocks.name: od1
blocks.content: The order of the group identity is one. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm od1(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wceq(cfv(c1, c2), nat1))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cod, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(c0g, c0))
} = {
  syl(wcel(c0, cgrp), wceq(cfv(c1, c2), nat1), wcel(cfv(c1, c2), co(nat1, cfz, nat1)))
  syl3anc(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(cfv(c1, c2), co(nat1, cfz, nat1)), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(nat1, cn), wceq(co(nat1, cfv(cmg, c0), c2), c2))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(nat1, cn))
  1nn()
  syl(wcel(c0, cgrp), wceq(co(nat1, cfv(cmg, c0), c2), c2), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  grpidcl(c0, c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  mulg1(c2, cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cmg, c0), c0)
  odlem2(c2, cfv(cbs, c0), nat1, cfv(cmg, c0), c2, c1, c0)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cmg, c0))
  elfz1eq(cfv(c1, c2), nat1)
}

blocks.name: odeq1
blocks.content: The group identity is the unique element of a group with order one. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Sep-2015.)

thm odeq1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wb(wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat1), wceq(c1, c4)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cod, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(c0g, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
} = {
  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat1), wceq(c1, c4))
  syl5ib(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat1), wceq(c1, c4), wceq(co(nat1, cfv(cmg, c0), c1), co(cfv(c3, c1), cfv(cmg, c0), c1)))
  eqcomd(co(nat1, cfv(cmg, c0), c1), co(cfv(c3, c1), cfv(cmg, c0), c1), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat1))
  oveq1(cfv(c3, c1), nat1, cfv(cmg, c0), c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wb(wceq(co(nat1, cfv(cmg, c0), c1), co(cfv(c3, c1), cfv(cmg, c0), c1)), wceq(c1, c4)))
  eqeq12d(co(nat1, cfv(cmg, c0), c1), co(cfv(c3, c1), cfv(cmg, c0), c1), c1, c4, wcel(c1, c2))
  mulg1(c1, c2, cfv(cmg, c0), c0)
  odid(c1, c2, c3, cfv(cmg, c0), c4, c0)
  eqid(cfv(cmg, c0))
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(c1, c4), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat1), wceq(cfv(c3, c4), nat1))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(c3, c4), nat1))

blocks.name: odf1
blocks.content: The multiples of an element with infinite order form an infinite cyclic subgroup of ` G ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Sep-2015.)

  mtod(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c2, c1), wceq(cfv(c3, c2), nat0)), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(crn(cmpt(hs0, cz, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c0), c2))), cfn))

  biimp3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c2, c1), wceq(cfv(c3, c2), nat0), wf1(cmpt(hs0, cz, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c0), c2)), cz, c1))

  iftrued(cfv(chash, crn(cmpt(hs0, cz, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c0), c2)))), nat0, w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, c1)), wcel(crn(cmpt(hs0, cz, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c0), c2))), cfn))

  ssfid(ran((hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚Ü¶(hs0[(.g ` c0)]c2))), c1, (c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1))

  rabbidva(hs0, cn, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5)))
  eqeq12d(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cn)))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cn)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2)), wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cn0), wcel(c2, c0))
  simpll(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cn))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), cn0))
  nnnn0(cv(hs0))

  submmulg(c0, c1, cv(hs0), c2, cfv(cmg, c1), cfv(cmg, c5), c5)
  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cn), wceq(cfv(c0g, c1), cfv(c0g, c5)))
  subm0(c0, c1, cfv(c0g, c1), c5)
  ifbieq2d(nat0, cinf(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1))), cr, clt), cinf(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5))), cr, clt), wceq(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1))), crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5)))), wceq(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1))), emptycls), wceq(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5))), emptycls))
  eqeq1(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1))), crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5))), emptycls)
  infeq1(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1))), crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5))), cr, clt)
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wceq(cfv(c3, c2), cif(nat0, cinf(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1))), cr, clt), wceq(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1))), emptycls))), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, c1)))

  odval(hs0, c2, cfv(cbs, c1), c3, crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1))), c1, cfv(cmg, c1), cfv(c0g, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cmg, c1))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c1))
  eqid(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c1), c2), cfv(c0g, c1))))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wceq(cfv(c4, c2), cif(nat0, cinf(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5))), cr, clt), wceq(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5))), emptycls))), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, c5)))
  eleqtrd(c2, cfv(cbs, c5), c0, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c5)), wss(c0, cfv(cbs, c1)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wss(c0, cfv(cbs, c1)))
  submss(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c1))
  ressbas2(c0, cfv(cbs, c1), c5, c1)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))
  odval(hs0, c2, cfv(cbs, c5), c4, crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5))), c5, cfv(cmg, c5), cfv(c0g, c5))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c5))
  eqid(cfv(cmg, c5))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c5))
  eqid(crab(hs0, cn, wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c5), c2), cfv(c0g, c5))))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cmg, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c0g, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cmg, c5))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c0g, c5))
}

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà(SubMnd ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚Üí(c3 ` c2)=(c4 ` c2))
  ‚ä£ c5 =(c1[|`s]c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(od ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(od ` c5)
} = {
  3eqtr4d((c3 ` c2), (c4 ` c2), if({ hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c1)]c2)=(0 ` c1)} = ‚àÖ, 0, inf({ hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c1)]c2)=(0 ` c1)}, ‚Ñù, <)), if({ hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c5)]c2)=(0 ` c5)} = ‚àÖ, 0, inf({ hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c5)]c2)=(0 ` c5)}, ‚Ñù, <)), (c0 ‚àà(SubMnd ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0))

  rabbidva(hs0, cn, (c0 ‚àà(SubMnd ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0), (hs0[(.g ` c1)]c2)=(0 ` c1), (hs0[(.g ` c5)]c2)=(0 ` c5))
  eqeq12d((hs0[(.g ` c1)]c2), (0 ` c1), (hs0[(.g ` c5)]c2), (0 ` c5), ((c0 ‚àà(SubMnd ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚àß hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï))
  syl3anc(((c0 ‚àà(SubMnd ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚àß hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï), (hs0[(.g ` c1)]c2)=(hs0[(.g ` c5)]c2), c0 ‚àà(SubMnd ` c1), hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, c2 ‚àà c0)
  simpll(c0 ‚àà(SubMnd ` c1), c2 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  adantl((c0 ‚àà(SubMnd ` c1)‚àß c2 ‚àà c0), hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï, hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
  nnnn0(hs0)
  simplr(c0 ‚àà(SubMnd ` c1), c2 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  submmulg(c0, c1, hs0, c2, (.g ` c1), (.g ` c5), c5)
  ad2antrr(c0 ‚àà(SubMnd ` c1), c2 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï, (0 ` c1)=(0 ` c5))
  subm0(c0, c1, (0 ` c1), c5)
  ifbieq2d(nat0, inf({ hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c1)]c2)=(0 ` c1)}, ‚Ñù, <), inf({ hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c5)]c2)=(0 ` c5)}, ‚Ñù, <), { hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c1)]c2)=(0 ` c1)} = { hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c5)]c2)=(0 ` c5)}, { hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c1)]c2)=(0 ` c1)} = ‚àÖ, { hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c5)]c2)=(0 ` c5)} = ‚àÖ)
  eqeq1({ hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c1)]c2)=(0 ` c1)}, { hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c5)]c2)=(0 ` c5)}, emptycls)
  infeq1({ hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c1)]c2)=(0 ` c1)}, { hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï |(hs0[(.g ` c5)]c2)=(0 ` c5)}, cr, clt)

blocks.content: The order of an element is the same in a subgroup. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jan-2015.) (Proof shortened by Stefan O'Rear, 12-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: odsubdvds
blocks.content: The order of an element of a subgroup divides the order of the subgroup. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm odsubdvds(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0)), wbr(cfv(c3, c2), cdvds, cfv(chash, c0)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cod, c1))
} = {
  3brtr4d(cfv(c3, c2), cdvds, cfv(chash, c0), cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c0)), c2), cfv(chash, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c0))), w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0)))
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0)), wbr(cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c0)), c2), cdvds, cfv(chash, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c0)))), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp), wcel(cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c0)), cfn), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c0))))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(co(c1, cress, c0), cgrp))
  subggrp(c0, c1, co(c1, cress, c0))
  eqeltrrd(cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c0)), cfn, c0, w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0)))
  simp2(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0))
  eleqtrd(c2, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c0)), c0, w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0)))
  simp3(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0))
  oddvds2(co(c1, cress, c0), cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c0)), c2, cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c0)))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c0)))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0), wceq(cfv(c3, c2), cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c0)), c2)))
  subgod(c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c0)), co(c1, cress, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c0)))
  fveq2d(chash, c0, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0)))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2, c0), wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c0))))
  subgbas(c0, c1, co(c1, cress, c0))
  eqid(co(c1, cress, c0))

blocks.name: odhash
blocks.content: An element of zero order generates an infinite subgroup. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 12-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm odhash(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(c4, csn(c1))), cpnf))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cod, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cmrc, cfv(csubg, c0)))
} = {
  syl5reqr(cfv(chash, cfv(c4, csn(c1))), cpnf, cfv(chash, cz), w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat0)))
  mp2an(wceq(cfv(chash, cz), cpnf), wcel(cz, universe), wn(wcel(cz, cfn)))
  mtbir(wcel(cz, cfn), wcel(com, cfn))
  ominf()
  ax-mp(wb(wcel(cz, cfn), wcel(com, cfn)), wbr(cz, cen, com))
  entri(cz, com, cn)
  znnen()
  nnenom()
  enfi(cz, com)
  hashinf(cz, universe)
  3syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cz), cfv(chash, cfv(c4, csn(c1)))), wf1o(cmpt(hs0, cz, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c0), c1)), cz, cfv(c4, csn(c1))), wbr(cz, cen, cfv(c4, csn(c1))))
  odf1o1(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cmg, c0), c4)
  eqid(cfv(cmg, c0))
  f1oen(cmpt(hs0, cz, co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c0), c1)), cz, cfv(c4, csn(c1)))
  zex()
  hasheni(cz, cfv(c4, csn(c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cmg, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
}

blocks.name: odhash2
blocks.content: If an element has nonzero order, it generates a subgroup with size equal to the order. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 12-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cod, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cmrc, cfv(csubg, c0)))
} = {
  eqtr3d(cfv(chash, cfv(c4, csn(c1))), cfv(c3, c1), cfv(chash, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(c3, c1))), w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), cn)))
  3syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cfv(c3, c1), cn)), wceq(cfv(chash, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(c3, c1))), cfv(chash, cfv(c4, csn(c1)))), wf1o(cmpt(hs0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(c3, c1)), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmg, c0), c1)), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(c3, c1)), cfv(c4, csn(c1))), wbr(co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(c3, c1)), cen, cfv(c4, csn(c1))))

  infeq1d(hs1, cr, clt, c3, ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß hs0 = c0)‚àß hs1 = { s0 ‚àà ‚Ñï | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(Base ` hs0),(s0[(.g ` hs0)]s1)=(0 ` hs0))}))

blocks.name: gexlem1
blocks.content: The group element order is either zero or a nonzero multiplier that annihilates the element. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Apr-2016.) (Proof shortened by AV, 26-Sep-2020.)

thm gexlem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {

  eqeq2(nat0, cif(nat0, cinf(c3, cr, clt), wceq(c3, emptycls)), c2)
  imbi1d(wceq(cinf(c3, cr, clt), cif(nat0, cinf(c3, cr, clt), wceq(c3, emptycls))), wceq(c2, cinf(c3, cr, clt)), wo(wa(wceq(c2, nat0), wceq(c3, emptycls)), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(c2, cif(nat0, cinf(c3, cr, clt), wceq(c3, emptycls))))
  eqeq2(cinf(c3, cr, clt), cif(nat0, cinf(c3, cr, clt), wceq(c3, emptycls)), c2)
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c3, emptycls), wi(wceq(c2, nat0), wo(wa(wceq(c2, nat0), wceq(c3, emptycls)), wcel(c2, c3))))
  expcom(wceq(c3, emptycls), wceq(c2, nat0), wo(wa(wceq(c2, nat0), wceq(c3, emptycls)), wcel(c2, c3)))

  syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wceq(c3, emptycls))), wi(wceq(c2, cinf(c3, cr, clt)), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(cinf(c3, cr, clt), c3))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wceq(c3, emptycls))), wcel(cinf(c3, cr, clt), c3), wss(c3, cfv(cuz, nat1)), wne(c3, emptycls))
  3sstr4i(c3, cfv(cuz, nat1), crab(s0, cn, wral(s1, c4, wceq(co(cv(s0), c5, cv(s1)), c6))), cn)

blocks.name: gexdvds
blocks.content: The only ` N ` that annihilate all the elements of the group are the multiples of the group exponent. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2016.)

blocks.name: gexdvds2
blocks.content: An integer divides the group exponent iff it divides all the group orders. In other words, the group exponent is the LCM of the orders of all the elements. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm gexdvds2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wbr(c2, cdvds, c1), wral(s0, c3, wbr(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cdvds, c1))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cgex, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cod, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  bitr4d(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(c2, cdvds, c1), wral(s0, c3, wbr(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cdvds, c1)), wral(s0, c3, wceq(co(c1, cfv(cmg, c0), cv(s0)), cfv(c0g, c0))))
  gexdvds(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cmg, c0), cfv(c0g, c0))
  ralbidva(s0, c3, wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cdvds, c1), wceq(co(c1, cfv(cmg, c0), cv(s0)), cfv(c0g, c0)))
  an32s(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(cv(s0), c3), wb(wbr(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cdvds, c1), wceq(co(c1, cfv(cmg, c0), cv(s0)), cfv(c0g, c0))))
  3expa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(cv(s0), c3), wcel(c1, cz), wb(wbr(cfv(c4, cv(s0)), cdvds, c1), wceq(co(c1, cfv(cmg, c0), cv(s0)), cfv(c0g, c0))))
  oddvds(c0, cv(s0), c3, c1, c4, cfv(cmg, c0), cfv(c0g, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cmg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cmg, c0)
  diff.cmg.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0g, c0)
  diff.c0g.s(s0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cgrp)
  diff.cgrp.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c1, cz)
  diff.cz.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: gexod
blocks.content: Any group element is annihilated by any multiple of the group exponent. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm gexod(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wbr(cfv(c3, c1), cdvds, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cgex, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cod, c0))
} = {
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)), wbr(cfv(c3, c1), cdvds, c4), wceq(co(c4, cfv(cmg, c0), c1), cfv(c0g, c0)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(co(c4, cfv(cmg, c0), c1), cfv(c0g, c0)))
  gexid(c1, c2, c4, cfv(cmg, c0), cfv(c0g, c0), c0)
  mpd3an3(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wb(wbr(cfv(c3, c1), cdvds, c4), wceq(co(c4, cfv(cmg, c0), c1), cfv(c0g, c0))), wcel(c4, cz))
  nn0zd(c4, wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c4, cn0))
  gexcl(c0, cgrp, c4, c2)
  oddvds(c0, c1, c2, c4, c3, cfv(cmg, c0), cfv(c0g, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cmg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c0))
}

  a1ii(wb(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cgrp), wral(s0, c2, wrex(s1, cn0, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(s1))))))), diffsc(s0, c2))

  brab2a(hs1, hs0, c0, cpgp, c1, cprime, cgrp, wral(s0, c2, wrex(s1, cn0, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(s1))))), wral(s0, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), wrex(s1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), co(cv(hs1), cexp, cv(s1))))))
  raleqbidv(s0, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c2, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c1)), wrex(s1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), co(cv(hs1), cexp, cv(s1)))), wrex(s1, cn0, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(s1)))))

blocks.name: pgp0
blocks.content: The identity subgroup is a ` P ` -group for every prime ` P ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm pgp0(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)), wbr(c1, cpgp, co(c0, cress, csn(c2))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(c0g, c0))
} = {
  mpd(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)), wbr(c1, cpgp, co(c0, cress, csn(c2))), wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(cbs, co(c0, cress, csn(c2)))), co(c1, cexp, nat0)))
  eqtr2d(cfv(chash, cfv(cbs, co(c0, cress, csn(c2)))), co(c1, cexp, nat0), nat1, wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)))
  exp0d(c1, wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)))
  nncnd(c1, wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime), wcel(c1, cn))
  prmnn(c1)
  syl5eqr(nat1, cfv(chash, cfv(cbs, co(c0, cress, csn(c2)))), cfv(chash, csn(c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)))
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(chash, csn(c2)), nat1), wcel(c2, universe))
  fvexi(c2, c0g, c0)
  hashsng(c2, universe)
  fveq2d(chash, csn(c2), cfv(cbs, co(c0, cress, csn(c2))), wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)), wceq(csn(c2), cfv(cbs, co(c0, cress, csn(c2)))), wcel(csn(c2), cfv(csubg, c0)))
  subgbas(csn(c2), c0, co(c0, cress, csn(c2)))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)), wi(wceq(cfv(chash, cfv(cbs, co(c0, cress, csn(c2)))), co(c1, cexp, nat0)), wbr(c1, cpgp, co(c0, cress, csn(c2)))), wcel(co(c0, cress, csn(c2)), cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime), wcel(nat0, cn0))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)), wcel(co(c0, cress, csn(c2)), cgrp), wcel(csn(c2), cfv(csubg, c0)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime), wcel(csn(c2), cfv(csubg, c0)))
  0subg(c0, c2)
  subggrp(csn(c2), c0, co(c0, cress, csn(c2)))
  eqid(co(c0, cress, csn(c2)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cprime)), wcel(nat0, cn0))
  0nn0()
  pgpfi1(co(c0, cress, csn(c2)), c1, nat0, cfv(cbs, co(c0, cress, csn(c2))))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, co(c0, cress, csn(c2))))
}

thm pgp0(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime)‚Üí c1[pGrp](c0[|`s]{ c2 }))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(0 ` c0)
} = {
  mpd((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime), c1[pGrp](c0[|`s]{ c2 }), (# `(Base `(c0[|`s]{ c2 })))=(c1[^]0))
  eqtr2d((# `(Base `(c0[|`s]{ c2 }))), (c1[^]0), nat1, (c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime))
  exp0d(c1, (c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime))
  nncnd(c1, (c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime))
  adantl(c0 ‚àà Grp, c1 ‚àà Prime, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  prmnn(c1)
  syl5eqr(nat1, (# `(Base `(c0[|`s]{ c2 }))), (# ` { c2 }), (c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime))
  ax-mp((# ` { c2 })= 1, c2 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvexi(c2, c0g, c0)
  hashsng(c2, universe)
  fveq2d(chash, { c2 }, (Base `(c0[|`s]{ c2 })), (c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime))
  syl((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime), { c2 } =(Base `(c0[|`s]{ c2 })), { c2 } ‚àà(SubGrp ` c0))
  subgbas({ c2 }, c0, (c0[|`s]{ c2 }))
  syl3anc((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime), ((# `(Base `(c0[|`s]{ c2 })))=(c1[^]0)‚Üí c1[pGrp](c0[|`s]{ c2 })), (c0[|`s]{ c2 })‚àà Grp, c1 ‚àà Prime, 0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
  syl((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime), (c0[|`s]{ c2 })‚àà Grp, { c2 } ‚àà(SubGrp ` c0))
  adantr(c0 ‚àà Grp, c1 ‚àà Prime, { c2 } ‚àà(SubGrp ` c0))
  0subg(c0, c2)
  subggrp({ c2 }, c0, (c0[|`s]{ c2 }))
  eqid((c0[|`s]{ c2 }))
  simpr(c0 ‚àà Grp, c1 ‚àà Prime)
  a1i((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà Prime), 0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
  0nn0()
  pgpfi1((c0[|`s]{ c2 }), c1, nat0, (Base `(c0[|`s]{ c2 })))
  eqid((Base `(c0[|`s]{ c2 })))
}

blocks.name: subgpgp
blocks.content: A subgroup of a p-group is a p-group. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm subgpgp(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))), wbr(c0, cpgp, co(c1, cress, c2)))
} = {

  adantr(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(c0, cprime))
  pgpprm(c0, c1)
  adantl(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(co(c1, cress, c2), cgrp))
  subggrp(c2, c1, co(c1, cress, c2))
  mpbid(wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c2)), wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))), wral(hs0, c2, wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))))
  mpd(wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))), wral(hs0, c2, wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, c1), wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))))
  adantr(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1)), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, c1), wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))))
  simp3bi(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, c1), wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))), wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cgrp))
  ispgp(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(cod, c1))
  sylibd(wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))), wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, c1), wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))), wral(hs0, c2, wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))), wral(hs0, c2, wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))))
  syl(wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))), wi(wral(hs0, cfv(cbs, c1), wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))), wral(hs0, c2, wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1)))))), wss(c2, cfv(cbs, c1)))
  adantl(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1)), wss(c2, cfv(cbs, c1)))
  subgss(c2, c1, cfv(cbs, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))
  ssralv(hs0, c2, cfv(cbs, c1), wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1)))))
  ralbidva(hs0, c2, wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))), wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1)))), wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1)))))
  rexbidv(hs1, cn0, wa(wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))), wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1))))
  eqeq1d(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1)), cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)), cv(hs0)), wa(wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  adantll(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c1), cv(hs0)), cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)), cv(hs0))))
  subgod(c2, c1, cv(hs0), cfv(cod, c1), cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)), co(c1, cress, c2))
  eqid(cfv(cod, c1))
  raleqdv(hs0, c2, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c2)), wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))), wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)), cv(hs0)), co(c0, cexp, cv(hs1)))))
  adantl(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1)), wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c2))))
  subgbas(c2, c1, co(c1, cress, c2))
  eqid(co(c1, cress, c2))
  ispgp(hs0, hs1, c0, co(c1, cress, c2), cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c2)), cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c2)))
  eqid(cfv(cod, co(c1, cress, c2)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, c1))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))))
  diff.hs1.w(wa(wa(wbr(c0, cpgp, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, co(c1, cress, c2)))
  diff.hs0.c(co(c1, cress, c2))
  diff.hs1.c(co(c1, cress, c2))
}

blocks.name: sylow1lem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow1 . The p-adic valuation of the size of ` S ` is equal to the number of excess powers of ` P ` in ` ( # `` X ) / ( P ^ N ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2015.)

blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow1 . The function ` .(+) ` is a group action on ` S ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow1lem3
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow1 . One of the orbits of the group action has p-adic valuation less than the prime count of the set ` S ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow1lem4
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow1 . The stabilizer subgroup of any element of ` S ` is at most ` P ^ N ` in size. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow1lem5
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow1 . Using Lagrange's theorem and the orbit-stabilizer theorem, show that there is a subgroup with size exactly ` P ^ N ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow1
blocks.content: Sylow's first theorem. If ` P ^ N ` is a prime power that divides the cardinality of ` G ` , then ` G ` has a supgroup with size ` P ^ N ` . This is part of Metamath 100 proof #72. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: odcau
blocks.content: Cauchy's theorem for the order of an element in a group. A finite group whose order divides a prime ` P ` contains an element of order ` P ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm odcau(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cprime)), wbr(c2, cdvds, cfv(chash, c1))), wrex(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), c2)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cod, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  mpd(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cprime)), wbr(c2, cdvds, cfv(chash, c1))), wrex(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), c2)), wrex(hs0, cfv(csubg, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), co(c2, cexp, nat1))))
  sylow1(hs0, c0, c2, nat1, c1, wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cprime)), wbr(c2, cdvds, cfv(chash, c1))))
  a1i(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cprime)), wbr(c2, cdvds, cfv(chash, c1))), wcel(nat1, cn0))
  1nn0()
  eqbrtrd(co(c2, cexp, nat1), cdvds, cfv(chash, c1), c2, wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cprime)), wbr(c2, cdvds, cfv(chash, c1))))
  simpr(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cprime)), wbr(c2, cdvds, cfv(chash, c1)))
  rexlimdva(hs0, cfv(csubg, c0), wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cprime)), wbr(c2, cdvds, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), co(c2, cexp, nat1)), wrex(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), c2)))
  sylbid(wa(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cprime)), wbr(c2, cdvds, cfv(chash, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(csubg, c0))), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), co(c2, cexp, nat1)), wrex(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), c2)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c2))

  eqeq2d(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), co(c2, cexp, nat1), c2, wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cprime)), wbr(c2, cdvds, cfv(chash, c1))))

  prmnn(c2)
  expr(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cprime)), wbr(c2, cdvds, cfv(chash, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(csubg, c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c2), wrex(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), c2)))

blocks.name: pgpfi
blocks.content: The converse to ~ pgpfi1 . A finite group is a ` P ` -group iff it has size some power of ` P ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm pgpfi(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn)), wb(wbr(c2, cpgp, c0), wa(wcel(c2, cprime), wrex(s0, cn0, wceq(cfv(chash, c1), co(c2, cexp, cv(s0)))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn)), wbr(c2, cpgp, c0), wa(wcel(c2, cprime), wrex(s0, cn0, wceq(cfv(chash, c1), co(c2, cexp, cv(s0))))))

  ispgp(hs0, hs1, c2, c0, c1, cfv(cod, c0))

  3adantr2(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(c2, cprime), wcel(c0, cgrp), wral(hs0, c1, wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c0), cv(hs0)), co(c2, cexp, cv(hs1))))), wa(wcel(c2, cprime), wrex(s0, cn0, wceq(cfv(chash, c1), co(c2, cexp, cv(s0))))))

  mpbird(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn)), wa(wcel(c2, cprime), wral(hs0, c1, wrex(hs1, cn0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cod, c0), cv(hs0)), co(c2, cexp, cv(hs1))))))), wbr(cfv(chash, c1), cdvds, co(c2, cexp, co(c2, cpc, cfv(chash, c1)))), wral(hs2, cprime, wbr(co(cv(hs2), cpc, cfv(chash, c1)), cle, co(cv(hs2), cpc, co(c2, cexp, co(c2, cpc, cfv(chash, c1)))))))

blocks.name: pgpfi2
blocks.content: Alternate version of ~ pgpfi . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm pgpfi2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn)), wb(wbr(c2, cpgp, c0), wa(wcel(c2, cprime), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), co(c2, cexp, co(c2, cpc, cfv(chash, c1)))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))
} = {
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn)), wbr(c2, cpgp, c0), wa(wcel(c2, cprime), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), co(c2, cexp, co(c2, cpc, cfv(chash, c1))))), wa(wcel(c2, cprime), wrex(hs0, cn0, wceq(cfv(chash, c1), co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0))))))
  pgpfi(hs0, c0, c1, c2)
  pm5.32da(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(c2, cprime), wrex(hs0, cn0, wceq(cfv(chash, c1), co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0)))), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), co(c2, cexp, co(c2, cpc, cfv(chash, c1)))))
  syl2anr(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(c2, cprime), wb(wrex(hs0, cn0, wceq(cfv(chash, c1), co(c2, cexp, cv(hs0)))), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), co(c2, cexp, co(c2, cpc, cfv(chash, c1))))), wcel(c2, cprime), wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cn))
  id(wcel(c2, cprime))
  imp(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cn))
  syl5ibrcom(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cn), wne(c1, emptycls))
  grpbn0(c0, c1)
  hashnncl(c1)
  pcprmpw(hs0, c2, cfv(chash, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(chash, c1))
}

blocks.name: isslw
blocks.content: The property of being a Sylow subgroup. A Sylow ` P ` -subgroup is a ` P ` -group which has no proper supersets that are also ` P ` -groups. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow2alem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow2a . An equivalence class of fixed points is a singleton. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm sylow2alem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wceq(cec(c0, c2), csn(c0)))

blocks.name: sylow2alem2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow2a . All the orbits which are not for fixed points have size ` | G | / | G x | ` (where ` G x ` is the stabilizer subgroup) and thus are powers of ` P ` . And since they are all nontrivial (because any orbit which is a singleton is a fixed point), they all divide ` P ` , and so does the sum of all of them. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow2a
blocks.content: A named lemma of Sylow's second and third theorems. If ` G ` is a finite ` P ` -group that acts on the finite set ` Y ` , then the set ` Z ` of all points of ` Y ` fixed by every element of ` G ` has cardinality equivalent to the cardinality of ` Y ` , ` mod P ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow2blem2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow2b . Left multiplication in a subgroup ` H ` is a group action on the set of all left cosets of ` K ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow2blem3
blocks.content: Sylow's second theorem. Putting together the results of ~ sylow2a and the orbit-stabilizer theorem to show that ` P ` does not divide the set of all fixed points under the group action, we get that there is a fixed point of the group action, so that there is some ` g e. X ` with ` h g K = g K ` for all ` h e. H ` . This implies that ` invg ( g ) h g e. K ` , so ` h ` is in the conjugated subgroup ` g K invg ( g ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow2b
blocks.content: Sylow's second theorem. Any ` P ` -group ` H ` is a subgroup of a conjugated ` P ` -group ` K ` of order ` P ^ n || ( # `` X ) ` with ` n ` maximal. This is usually stated under the assumption that ` K ` is a Sylow subgroup, but we use a slightly different definition, whose equivalence to this one requires this theorem. This is part of Metamath 100 proof #72. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: fislw
blocks.content: The sylow subgroups of a finite group are exactly the groups which have cardinality equal to the maximum power of ` P ` dividing the group. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: sylow2
blocks.content: Sylow's second theorem. See also ~ sylow2b for the "hard" part of the proof. Any two Sylow ` P ` -subgroups are conjugate to one another, and hence the same size, namely ` P ^ ( P pCnt | X | ) ` (see ~ fislw ). This is part of Metamath 100 proof #72. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm sylow2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))))))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, co(c6, cslw, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, co(c6, cslw, c5)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cplusg, c5))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(csg, c5))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

  -| diffsc(s0, c3)

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)

} = {
  reximddv(s0, c0, w0, wceq(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))))
  syl3anc(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))))), wceq(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))), wcel(crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))), cfn), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))), wbr(c1, cen, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))))
  ssfid(crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))), c0, wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))))))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))))), wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))))), wss(crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))), c0), wcel(crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))), cfv(csubg, c5)))
  syl2an2r(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))))), wcel(crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))), cfv(csubg, c5)), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c5)), wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  conjsubg(s1, c2, c5, cv(s0), c0, cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))), c3, c4)
  subgss(crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))), c5, c0)
  simprr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))))
  syl2an2r(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))))), wbr(c1, cen, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))), wbr(c1, cen, c2), wbr(c2, cen, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))))

  eqtr4d(cfv(chash, c1), cfv(chash, c2), co(c6, cexp, co(c6, cpc, cfv(chash, c0))), w0)
  slwhash(c1, c6, c0, c5, w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wb(wceq(cfv(chash, c1), cfv(chash, c2)), wbr(c1, cen, c2)), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2, cfn))
  ssfid(c1, c0, w0)
  syl(w0, wss(c1, c0), wcel(c1, cfv(csubg, c5)))
  subgss(c1, c5, c0)
  ssfid(c2, c0, w0)

  syl2an2r(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0)))))), wbr(c2, cen, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c5)), wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  simprl(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wss(c1, crn(cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))))))
  conjsubgen(s1, c2, c5, cv(s0), c0, cmpt(s1, c2, co(co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)), c4, cv(s0))), c3, c4)

  syl(w0, wbr(c6, cpgp, co(c5, cress, c1)), wcel(c1, co(c6, cslw, c5)))
  slwpgp(c1, c6, c5, co(c5, cress, c1))

blocks.name: sylow3lem2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow3 , first part. The stabilizer of a given Sylow subgroup ` K ` in the group action ` .(+) ` acting on all of ` G ` is the normalizer N_G(K). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow3lem3
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow3 , first part. The number of Sylow subgroups is the same as the index (number of cosets) of the normalizer of the Sylow subgroup ` K ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow3lem4
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow3 , first part. The number of Sylow subgroups is a divisor of the size of ` G ` reduced by the size of a Sylow subgroup of ` G ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow3lem6
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sylow3 , second part. Using the lemma ~ sylow2a , show that the number of sylow subgroups is equivalent ` mod P ` to the number of fixed points under the group action. But ` K ` is the unique element of the set of Sylow subgroups that is fixed under the group action, so there is exactly one fixed point and so ` ( ( # `` ( P pSyl G ) ) mod P ) = 1 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: sylow3
blocks.content: Sylow's third theorem. The number of Sylow subgroups is a divisor of ` | G | / d ` , where ` d ` is the common order of a Sylow subgroup, and is equivalent to ` 1 mod P ` . This is part of Metamath 100 proof #72. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm sylow3(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {

  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cgrp))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cprime))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(chash, co(c2, cslw, c3)))
} = {

  syl5eqbr(c0, cdvds, co(cfv(chash, c1), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, co(c2, cpc, cfv(chash, c1)))), cfv(chash, co(c2, cslw, c3)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, cslw, c3))))
